page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content:
The main town in the block is Cleator Moor, surrounded by hills and mountains. There are also two other villages in the block, Moor Row and Cleator.
There are some lovely views of the mountains of the Lake District and the River Ehen in the block. There are several hump-backed narrow bridges, a ford and a seven arched aquaduct can be accessed from the north west corner.
The town is not prosperous and sometimes appears shabby and sleepy but its residents are fiercely loyal. People moving away often pine for home and return if possible.
